abstract: European Union reaches agreement with Turkey to ease migrant crisis by sending asylum seekers who take hidden routes to Greece, in effort to reach Continent, back to Turkey; deal is latest effort by EU to keep mass migration from straining resources and encourage legal path to Europe by offering resettlement in Turkey, particularly to large number of Syrians; humanitarian groups warn deal violates international law.

headline.print_headline: E.U. Pact to Send Fresh Migrants Back to Turkey
headline.main: European Union Reaches Deal With Turkey to Return New Asylum Seekers

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The move to send migrants who arrive in Greece back to Turkey was a significant step amid a crisis that has left tens of thousands of people in squalid conditions.
lead_paragraph: The move to send migrants who arrive in Greece back to Turkey was a significant step amid a crisis that has left tens of thousands of people in squalid conditions.
